results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/emails - Add account email

covered_items: POST Valid Payload: Happy-path creation returns 201, asserts JSON array response and Location header; DB association verified (TC01, TC03–TC05).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy present/absent and optional Reason/Comment covered (TC02, TC05, TC13).
Path Parameter Validation: Invalid UUID format and missing accountId -> 400; non-existent account -> 404 (TC07–TC09).
Request Body Validation: Malformed JSON, empty body, missing required fields, invalid email format -> 400 (TC10–TC12, TC17).
Boundary/Large Payloads: Maximum field sizes covered (TC16).
Extraneous Inputs: Extra body fields and unexpected query params considered (TC06, TC18).
Security: SQL injection and XSS attempts rejected (TC23, TC24).
Resilience/Errors: External dependency down -> 503; slow DB/perf thresholds; transient network retry (TC15, TC19, TC25).
Concurrency: Concurrent POSTs handled without duplication/data loss (TC20).
Integration: POST effects verified via subsequent GET and downstream propagation (TC26).
Internationalization: Unicode/special character handling covered (TC21).
Authorization: Invalid/missing token scenarios covered (TC14).
gaps: Duplicate Submission: No scenario for posting the same email twice (idempotency/uniqueness). Expect 409 Conflict or idempotent behavior.
Server Error Handling (500): No test simulating unexpected internal errors distinct from 503 dependency failures.
Content Negotiation/Headers: Missing tests for incorrect or absent Content-Type (expect 415), unsupported Accept (406), and verifying response Content-Type is application/json.
Response Shape Consistency: Several success scenarios assert a single object instead of the spec’s JSON array; no strict schema validation of the array/items.
Location Header Semantics: Presence is checked, but not validated for correct resource URL format; ambiguity between single resource vs list not resolved.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No tests for burst traffic leading to 429 Too Many Requests.
Header Value Validation: No tests for empty/whitespace or overly long X-Killbill-CreatedBy; no validation of Reason/Comment length/charset.
Ambiguous Expectations: Multiple scenarios state "201 or 400/422/503 depending on behavior", which is non-deterministic for acceptance tests (TC06, TC13, TC14, TC16, TC18, TC19, TC21).
Background Setup Leakage: Background sets optional headers for all tests, which may invalidate scenarios that intend to test only required or missing headers.
recommendations: Add duplicate submission tests: same email posted twice sequentially and via retry; define expected outcome (409 Conflict vs idempotent 200/201 with no duplication).
Add content-negotiation tests: missing/wrong Content-Type -> 415; unsupported Accept -> 406; verify response Content-Type header is application/json.
Introduce explicit 500 Internal Server Error test by forcing an unhandled exception path; assert standardized error payload (code, message, requestId).

Make tests deterministic: replace "201 or 4xx/5xx" with a single expected status per case after clarifying behavior with API owners (extra fields, unicode emails, auth failures, large payload limits).

Align success assertions with spec: assert response is always a JSON array of AccountEmail objects; validate against the AccountEmail schema (required fields, types, no additionalProperties if applicable).
Validate Location header: ensure it points to the created email resource (or well-defined list endpoint) and matches the created entity; assert absolute/relative format per spec.
Add rate limiting scenarios: burst POSTs leading to 429 and proper Retry-After handling.
Expand header value validation: test empty/blank X-Killbill-CreatedBy and long/special-char values; assert proper 400 with descriptive error.
Isolate header setup: move optional headers out of Background; set headers per scenario or use Scenario Outlines to avoid cross-test contamination.
Clarify and then test extra body field handling (TC06): either reject with 400 and explicit error list or ignore safely; assert behavior.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId} - Update account

covered_items: PUT Valid Request: Successful 204 responses with correct persistence are verified (TC01, TC02).
Partial Update: Supported and validated via subset updates and treatNullAsReset true/false behaviors (TC03, TC04, TC19).
Non-Existing Resource: Update of a non-existent account is handled (TC08).
Concurrency Issues: Concurrent updates tested; final state consistency verified (TC17).
Authorization: Unauthorized access correctly returns 401 (TC09).
Validation: Invalid account data, invalid UUID format, boundary values, and wrong data types produce 400 (TC06, TC07, TC20, TC21).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced; optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment covered (TC02, TC05).
Query Parameters: treatNullAsReset semantics covered (true, false/omitted); extraneous query params ignored (TC03, TC04, TC22).
Error Handling: Server-side failure path covered with 500 (TC12).
Security/Robustness: Injection attempts handled; unsupported fields ignored; empty body rejected; large payload and latency considered (TC10, TC11, TC13, TC14, TC18).
gaps: Success response semantics: No assertion that 204 returns no body; “Produces: application/json” vs 204 behavior not validated.
Request content-type handling: No tests for missing/incorrect Content-Type (e.g., 415 Unsupported Media Type) or Accept negotiation.
Query param validation: No test for invalid treatNullAsReset values (e.g., treatNullAsReset=foo) resulting in 400.
Idempotency: No scenario confirming that repeating the same PUT yields the same result without side effects.
Immutable/read-only fields: No explicit test attempting to change non-updatable fields (e.g., accountId in body) and asserting ignore or 400.
Error payload schema: Tests do not assert standardized error response structure/content.
Status code clarity: Non-existent account tested as 400; clarify if 404 Not Found is expected and test accordingly.
Payload limits: No failure-path test when exceeding payload size limits (e.g., 413 Payload Too Large).
RBAC/Forbidden: 401 is covered; no 403 Forbidden test for authenticated but unauthorized users.
Test design hygiene: Background enforces valid auth yet TC09 requires invalid/missing auth; conflicting setup may mask issues.
recommendations: Assert 204 No Content semantics explicitly: no response body and appropriate headers; validate Content-Type primarily on error responses.
Add tests for missing/wrong Content-Type (expect 415) and unsupported Accept headers (406) if applicable.
Add a test where treatNullAsReset is a non-boolean (e.g., foo) and expect 400.
Add an idempotency test: send identical PUT twice and verify identical state and status codes.
Add a scenario attempting to modify immutable fields (e.g., accountId or read-only Account fields) and assert rejection or ignore per spec.
Validate error response schema for 400/401/500 (e.g., code, message, type) to ensure consistent error formatting.
Clarify expected status for non-existent account (400 vs 404) and align tests accordingly.
Introduce a payload-size boundary test that exceeds limits to expect 413 Payload Too Large.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario to cover role/permission-based authorization.
Refactor Background to avoid mandatory valid auth for all scenarios; set auth at the scenario level to prevent contradictions.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from account

covered_items: DELETE Method - Valid Deletion: Success flows covered for deleting all or a subset, returning 204 with empty body, and verifying via subsequent GET (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC13, TC18).
DELETE Method - Non-Existent Resource: Behavior when the account does not exist is exercised (TC06).
DELETE Method - Concurrency/Idempotency: Repeated deletion and high concurrency are tested; operations remain idempotent with 204 (TC15, TC16).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (TC07) and optional X-Killbill-Reason/Comment handled (TC03).
Input validation: accountId UUID pattern (TC05), customField UUIDs (TC08), duplicate IDs (TC14), extra unsupported parameters (TC09), and large lists (TC13).
Error handling: 400 on invalid inputs (TC05, TC08), 500 on dependency failure (TC11), and timeout/504 behavior (TC12).
Authorization: Unauthorized/forbidden access handled (TC10).
Security: Injection/XSS attempts rejected (TC19, TC20).
Integration/Consistency: State validated after deletion via GET and dependent services reflect changes (TC01, TC02, TC17).
No-data case: Deleting when no custom fields exist returns 204 and empty list on GET (TC04).
gaps: DELETE Method - Soft Deletes: No test to confirm whether deletion is hard vs soft (guideline asks to check soft deletion behavior).

Response headers/content negotiation: No assertions for response headers (e.g., Content-Type) despite Produces: application/json; especially for error responses. 204 semantics validated for empty body but not headers.
Error body schema: No validation of a standardized error structure (fields/codes) for 4xx/5xx responses.
Atomicity: No scenario proving all-or-nothing behavior when a request includes multiple customField IDs and one is invalid (should fail without partial deletion).
Mixed validity list: No test where the customField list contains both valid and invalid IDs to verify outcome and rollback.

Non-existent customField IDs: No explicit test supplying IDs that do not belong to the account (or already removed) to confirm expected behavior (e.g., ignore and return 204) independently of regression case.
Authorization granularity: 401 vs 403 are combined; separate, deterministic scenarios for each are missing.
Concurrency race on overlapping subsets: No test where concurrent requests delete overlapping subsets (e.g., A,B vs B,C) to verify final state and absence of conflicts.
Empty/blank parameter handling: Behavior for customField= (empty value) or whitespace-only parameters not covered.
Header value boundaries/encoding: No tests for very long or non-ASCII X-Killbill-Reason/Comment values.
recommendations: Add a scenario to assert hard vs soft delete semantics per guideline; if hard delete is intended, verify no soft-delete flags and that GET shows permanent removal.
Assert response headers: check Content-Type is application/json for error responses; ensure 204 responses have no body and appropriate headers; include Accept negotiation if applicable.
Add atomicity test: when any customField ID in the list is invalid, expect 400 and no changes; verify via GET.
Add a scenario with mixed existing and non-existing customField IDs; document and assert the intended behavior (e.g., ignore missing and return 204).
Split authorization into two cases: unauthenticated (401) and authenticated without permission (403) to ensure correct status mapping.
Add a race-condition test deleting overlapping subsets concurrently (A,B vs B,C) and assert final state and idempotent 204 responses.
Validate empty/blank customField parameters (e.g., customField=) return a 400 with a clear message.
Add boundary/encoding tests for X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment (length, non-ASCII/UTF-8).
For 500/timeout scenarios, explicitly assert no partial deletions by re-fetching and verifying the original state remains unchanged.
Optionally verify audit trail/history captures CreatedBy/Reason/Comment if the platform supports audit logs.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/payments - Retrieve account payments

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful 200 responses for required path parameter and combinations of query parameters, with response schema checks for Payment objects.
Empty Response: Accounts with no payments and non-existent accounts return empty arrays.

Query Parameters: Extensive coverage of withAttempts, withPluginInfo, pluginProperty (multi), and audit (FULL, MINIMAL), including combined params, unsupported params ignored, malformed/empty pluginProperty, and invalid audit value.
Authorization: 401 cases for missing and invalid/expired tokens are covered.
Input Validation and Error Handling: 400 for invalid accountId format; injection/XSS attempts rejected.
Service Resilience: Upstream/service-down cases covered (503 for KillBill down; plugin service unavailable handled gracefully).
Performance/Load: Large data volume and concurrent request behavior tested.
State Variation: Partially populated payment objects handled (optional/null fields).
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios verifying pagination behavior for large datasets (or explicit confirmation that the endpoint is not paginated).
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/If-None-Match, Last-Modified, or Cache-Control headers; no 304 Not Modified flow.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No coverage for 429 Too Many Requests and Retry-After headers.
Authorization (403): No scenario for authenticated but unauthorized/forbidden access.
Content Negotiation/Headers: No assertion that Content-Type is application/json; no tests for Accept header behavior.
Default Parameter Behavior: No explicit tests for audit=NONE and default audit when omitted; no assertions that withAttempts and withPluginInfo are absent by default.
Type Coercion/Invalid Booleans: No tests for withAttempts or withPluginInfo with non-boolean values (e.g., withAttempts=foo) and expected handling.
Non-existent Account Contract: Behavior is assumed as 200 with empty array; lack of test or documentation for alternative (e.g., 404).
Schema depth: PaymentAttempt and pluginInfo sub-object schemas are not validated beyond presence.
recommendations: Add pagination tests (or document N/A): verify page parameters or absence thereof; if paginated, test links/next-page and boundary conditions.
Add caching tests: assert ETag/Cache-Control headers; perform conditional GET with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since and expect 304.
Add rate limiting tests: burst requests to trigger 429 and validate Retry-After and error body.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for a user lacking permission to the account.
Assert headers: Content-Type=application/json; optionally test Accept header negotiation and charset.
Test defaults: audit omitted should default to NONE; audit=NONE explicit; verify withAttempts and withPluginInfo are false by default and that related fields are absent.
Validate invalid boolean inputs (withAttempts=foo, withPluginInfo=1) and define behavior (400 or coercion).
Clarify contract for non-existent account (200 empty vs 404) and align tests with the agreed behavior.
Deepen schema checks for paymentAttempts and pluginInfo objects against their definitions.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/customFields/{customFieldId}/auditLogsWithHistory - Retrieve custom field audit logs with history by id

covered_items: Valid Request: TC01 verifies 200 status, application/json content type, and a JSON array of AuditLog objects with required fields.
Empty Response: TC02 and TC12 confirm 200 with an empty JSON array when no audit logs exist.
Error handling (per story): TC03 (custom field not found) and TC04 (associated account not found) return 404 as required.

Path parameter validation: TC05 (invalid UUID -> 400), TC15 (missing id -> 400/404), TC17 (leading/trailing spaces -> 400/404), TC10 (extra path segment -> 404), and TC16 (boundary UUIDs) cover input robustness.
Authorization (authentication): TC06 and TC07 validate 401 for missing or invalid tokens.
Server error handling: TC08 covers 503 Service Unavailable with safe error messaging.
Security hardening: TC09 SQL injection attempt handled safely (400/404) without leaking stack traces.
Performance and concurrency: TC11 (very large result set) and TC14 (100 concurrent requests) validate responsiveness and stability.
Backward compatibility: TC13 ensures older User-Agent still receives 200 and JSON.
Produces/format: Multiple scenarios assert Content-Type application/json; TC01 checks objects align to AuditLog definition.
gaps: Caching Behavior: No assertions for ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control headers or conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since -> 304).
Rate Limiting: No tests to trigger or validate throttling behavior (e.g., 429 Too Many Requests and Retry-After).
Authorization breadth: No 403 Forbidden scenarios for authenticated users lacking required permissions or cross-tenant access restrictions.
Pagination: Not covered; if the endpoint supports limit/offset or pagination for large datasets, there are no tests for page boundaries and consistency.

With-history semantics: While TC01 checks AuditLog required fields, there are no explicit checks that 'withHistory' returns full history details per entry and that histories are correct and chronologically ordered.
Error response schema: Negative tests check for error messages but do not validate the standardized error model (e.g., code/type fields) across 400/401/403/404/503.
recommendations: Add caching scenarios: verify ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control on 200 responses and exercise conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) expecting 304 when unchanged.
Add rate limiting tests: issue burst traffic to trigger 429 and validate Retry-After; ensure system recovers without degraded performance.
Expand authorization tests: use a valid token lacking necessary permissions or from a different tenant; expect 403 with proper error body.

Clarify pagination support: if supported, add tests for limit/offset (first, middle, last page, invalid values); if not supported, document as N/A and ensure TC11 confirms complete result set returned.

Strengthen 'with history' validation: assert presence and schema of history details per AuditLog (e.g., changeType, createdDate, previous/new values, changedBy), verify chronological ordering, and match against known fixture changes.
Validate error response schema consistently: assert standard error structure (status/code/message) and absence of sensitive details for 400/401/403/404/503 responses.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods - Add a payment method

covered_items: POST - Valid payload: 201 created with body and Location header (TC01); variations with query params and headers (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC08).
POST - Large payloads: max-size payload handled (TC10) and minimal payload (TC11).
POST - Validation: malformed JSON (TC12), missing required fields (TC13), invalid accountId format (TC14), non-existent account 404 (TC15).
Headers: required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (TC16); optional Reason/Comment accepted (TC05).
Query parameters: isDefault, payAllUnpaidInvoices, controlPluginName (multi), pluginProperty (multi) covered, including combined usage (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC08).
Unexpected inputs: extra query parameter ignored (TC09).
Authorization: 401 for invalid or missing auth token (TC17).
Server error handling: 503 when plugin service is down (TC18); 500 on inconsistent plugin data (TC27).
Security hardening: SQL injection and XSS attempts rejected (TC19, TC20).
Reliability and duplicates: network failure retry does not create duplicates (TC21); concurrent POSTs do not create duplicates (TC23).
Performance and timeout behavior covered under normal and peak load (TC22, TC28, TC29).
Integration side effects: downstream sync verified after creation (TC26).
gaps: Response contract not fully asserted: no checks that response Content-Type is application/json and that Accept negotiation behaves as expected.
No test for 415 Unsupported Media Type when Content-Type is not application/json.
Omitted query parameter defaults are not asserted (isDefault and payAllUnpaidInvoices should default to false).
No validation for non-boolean query values (e.g., isDefault=abc should return 400).
No test for unknown or invalid controlPluginName values and expected error behavior.
No simulation of database persistence failure leading to 500 Internal Server Error.
Location header is checked for presence once, but there is no assertion that it follows the expected URL pattern and resolves to the created resource.
Authorization 403 (authenticated but not permitted) is not covered.
Rate limiting or throttling behavior for bursts of POST requests (429) not covered.
Status code expectations deviate from story: tests allow 422 for validation errors, while the story specifies 400.

No scenario for true duplicate submission with identical payload or unique key producing a deterministic outcome (e.g., 409 or safe deduplication) beyond network retry and concurrency with different payloads.
Audit persistence is not verified; Reason/Comment are only asserted in response, not in audit logs or history.
recommendations: Add a scenario to assert response headers: Content-Type is application/json and Location header matches expected pattern and resolves to the created resource.
Add a scenario for unsupported media type: send Content-Type other than application/json and expect 415.
Add scenarios validating default behaviors when query params are omitted: creation succeeds and the payment method is not default; unpaid invoices are not attempted.
Add negative query param validation: isDefault and payAllUnpaidInvoices with non-boolean strings should return 400 with a clear message.
Add a scenario where controlPluginName includes an unknown plugin and assert the proper error (per API contract, likely 400).
Simulate a database persistence failure to verify 500 handling and error body structure.
Add authorization test for 403 Forbidden when the caller lacks permission despite having a token.
Optionally add a rate limiting test to confirm correct handling of bursts (expect 429) if the platform enforces limits.
Align tests expecting 422 to the story’s contract (use 400) or update the story/spec; avoid ambiguous expectations like 400 or 422.
Add an explicit duplicate submission test with the same payload or unique external key to confirm conflict or dedup semantics (e.g., 409 or idempotent handling).
Verify audit trail: CreatedBy, Reason, and Comment are persisted in audit logs/history and retrievable via audit endpoints.
Consider adding an Idempotency-Key based retry test if supported by the API to guarantee no duplicates on client retries.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/versions - Retrieve a list of catalog versions

covered_items: Valid Request: Success scenarios with and without accountId return 200, application/json, and a JSON array of ISO 8601 date-time strings.
Empty Response: When no versions exist or the accountId is unknown, API returns 200 with an empty array; regression check ensures no stack traces.
Query Parameters: Broad coverage of accountId including valid UUID, mixed case, invalid formats, empty/whitespace, and unsupported extra params; SQL injection attempts are rejected.
Authorization: Missing/invalid tokens return 401 as expected.
Error Handling/Resilience: Scenarios cover 500 (malformed JSON), 503 (service down), and timeout behavior; performance and concurrency are exercised; backward compatibility verified.
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination parameters or behavior (page/size), boundary conditions, or explicit confirmation that pagination is not supported.
Rate Limiting: No scenarios validate 429 responses or rate-limit headers when thresholds are exceeded.
Caching Behavior: No validation of ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control headers, or conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) with 304 responses.
Authorization depth: No 403/tenant-authorization scenario (valid token but insufficient rights or cross-tenant access).
Response ordering and uniqueness: No assertions that dates are returned in a stable, documented order and without duplicates.
Content negotiation: No tests for Accept headers (e.g., non-JSON Accept yielding 406) or ensuring error responses also use application/json.
Error schema: Error responses aren’t validated against a consistent error envelope (e.g., code/message) across 4xx/5xx cases.
Ambiguity in TC11: Outcome is non-deterministic (200 or 504); expected behavior should be deterministic based on timeout policy.
recommendations: Add pagination scenarios: verify first/middle/last page, page-size limits, and out-of-range pages; if pagination is not supported, add negative tests asserting page/size are rejected or ignored and document behavior.
Introduce rate limiting tests: exceed request thresholds to assert 429 and validate X-RateLimit and Retry-After headers; ensure normal concurrency doesn’t trip limits.
Add caching tests: assert Cache-Control and ETag/Last-Modified on 200; perform conditional GETs to validate 304 responses; ensure error responses are not cacheable.
Extend authorization coverage: simulate valid auth with insufficient tenant permissions to assert 403 (or document intended behavior if 403 is not used).
Verify response ordering and uniqueness: assert a documented sort order (e.g., chronological ascending) and that duplicates are not returned.
Add content negotiation scenarios: vary Accept headers (application/json, */*, text/html) to assert correct behavior, including 406 when appropriate, and verify error responses use application/json.
Standardize error response assertions: validate a consistent JSON error schema (e.g., fields message, code) and application/json content-type for 4xx/5xx.
Clarify TC11 by splitting into deterministic tests aligned to the configured timeout policy so each test has a single expected outcome.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/timeline - Retrieve account timeline

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple success scenarios verify 200 responses and that a JSON AccountTimeline is returned, including default behavior with no query params.

Query Parameters: Strong coverage for audit (FULL, MINIMAL, default NONE implicitly), parallel (true), combined usage, invalid values (400), unsupported extra params ignored, and case-variance (Audit=FULL) documented.
Path Parameter Validation and Errors: Malformed UUID returns 400; non-existent account returns 404; edge cases for UUID length are exercised.
Empty Response: Accounts with no bundles/invoices/payments return a valid AccountTimeline with empty arrays (covered by dedicated scenarios).
Authorization: 401 responses covered for missing and invalid tokens.
Performance and Resilience: Large datasets, concurrent requests, timeout and retry behavior, and transient failures are addressed.
Fault Handling: 500 (DB down) and 503 (service down) scenarios included.
Security: SQL injection and XSS attempts handled safely with 400 responses and no sensitive leakage.
Regression and Backward Compatibility: Prior bug regressions and mixed-parameter behaviors (parallel=true) validated.
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests for ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control, or conditional requests (If-None-Match -> 304).
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios to trigger or validate 429 responses and related rate limit headers.
Pagination: No scenarios to confirm presence/absence of pagination for large timelines; behavior undefined for very large result sets.
Content Negotiation/Headers: No explicit checks for Content-Type: application/json or behavior with unacceptable Accept headers (e.g., 406).
Schema Validation: No strict JSON schema validation of AccountTimeline (required fields, types, nested entities) or error response schema.
Authorization Depth: No 403/insufficient-scope or cross-tenant access checks (if applicable).
Audit=NONE Explicit: Default NONE is implied but not explicitly exercised via audit=NONE query; also no comparison to confirm identical content vs default.
Ordering and Data Consistency: No assertion of chronological ordering of timeline events or referential consistency (e.g., payments reference invoices present in invoices array).
recommendations: Add caching tests: verify ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control; send If-None-Match to assert 304 Not Modified.
Add rate limiting tests: burst requests to elicit 429 and validate X-RateLimit headers and retry-after behavior.
Clarify pagination support; if supported, add limit/offset or Link header tests; if not, add a scenario asserting the endpoint returns all results without pagination metadata.
Assert headers: ensure Content-Type is application/json and test 406 with unacceptable Accept headers.
Introduce JSON Schema validation for AccountTimeline and error responses (types, required fields, ID formats).
Add authorization depth: test 403 for insufficient privileges or wrong tenant context if the platform supports RBAC/multi-tenancy.
Include explicit audit=NONE scenario and compare responses with default (no audit param) to confirm parity; also compare parallel=true vs default to ensure identical content and ordering.
Add tests to validate chronological ordering of timeline entries and referential integrity between payments, invoices, and bundles.
Refocus TC24: replace “screen reader” wording with API-centric checks (clear keys, consistent casing, predictable structure) or remove if non-actionable.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/bundles - Retrieve bundles for account

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful retrieval with 200 status and JSON array of Bundle objects, including required fields and default audit behavior (no audit data when audit not specified).
Empty Response: Account with no bundles returns 200 and empty array.

Query Parameters: Coverage for externalKey, bundlesFilter, audit (FULL, MINIMAL), and combined usage; invalid audit value handled; unexpected/extra parameter ignored; edge cases with empty/special character inputs considered.
Path Parameter Validation: Invalid UUID format for accountId returns 400.
Non-Existent Resource: 404 returned when account does not exist.
Authorization: Missing/invalid authentication token returns 401.
Robustness/Security: Malicious input attempts result in validation errors (400/422).
Performance: Large data volume scenario validates response time and correctness.
Resiliency: Upstream/downstream failure modes covered (502 dependency failure, 503 service unavailable, 504 timeout).
Concurrency: Multiple concurrent GET requests yield consistent 200 responses with correct bodies.
Regression/Compatibility: Regression check for previously fixed bug and backward compatibility for older clients.
Schema Compliance: Response structure validated against OpenAPI/Swagger Bundle definition.
Data Freshness: Newly created bundle is retrievable immediately after creation.
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios validating pagination behavior or result slicing for large datasets (limit/offset/page), if supported.
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/If-None-Match or Cache-Control/Last-Modified headers; no 304 Not Modified scenarios.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No tests for burst traffic resulting in 429 or verification of rate limit headers.
Content Negotiation/Headers: No explicit assertion on Content-Type: application/json; no Accept header negotiation or 406 Not Acceptable scenario.
Authorization Depth: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated user lacking permission/tenant access.
Audit Parameter Completeness: No explicit test for audit=NONE (only inferred via default); no case-sensitivity tests for audit values.
Negative Filtering Cases: No scenarios where externalKey or bundlesFilter are validly formatted but do not match any bundles (should return empty array).
Error Response Schema: Error payload structure (fields like code, message) not validated for 400/401/404/502/503/504.
Input Boundary Tests: No max-length/very long value tests for externalKey/bundlesFilter; no Unicode/whitespace trimming behavior validation.
Produces Clause: Although JSON body is asserted, the specification’s Produces: application/json is not explicitly validated via response headers.
recommendations: Add pagination tests (if supported): verify limit/offset/page parameters, default page size, boundaries, and deterministic ordering; otherwise document pagination as not applicable.
Introduce caching tests: assert ETag and Cache-Control headers on 200; send If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to validate 304 Not Modified.
Add rate limiting scenarios: high-frequency requests leading to 429 with appropriate X-RateLimit headers; verify retry-after guidance.
Assert content negotiation: verify Content-Type: application/json; send unsupported Accept (e.g., application/xml) and expect 406.
Expand authorization coverage: include 403 Forbidden for authenticated but unauthorized user/tenant as applicable.
Add explicit audit=NONE test and audit value case-sensitivity behavior (accept only enum-cased values or document normalization).
Include negative filtering tests: externalKey and bundlesFilter with no matches should return 200 and empty array.
Validate error schema: assert consistent error payload structure and fields across 400/401/404/502/503/504 responses.
Add input boundary tests for query params: extremely long values, Unicode, leading/trailing spaces, repeated parameters; confirm validation outcomes.
Explicitly verify Produces: application/json via response headers in happy-path scenarios.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/auditLogs - Retrieve audit logs by account id

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy-path retrieval returns 200 with application/json and a JSON array of AuditLog objects (TC01).
Empty Response: Accounts with no audit logs return 200 and an empty array (TC02, TC12).
Not Found: Non-existent account returns 404 with an explanatory error message (TC03).
Path Parameter Validation: Invalid, empty, and injection-style accountId values return 400/422 (TC04, TC10, TC15).
Authorization: Missing and invalid tokens correctly return 401 (TC05, TC06).
Query Parameters: Unknown/extra query parameters are tolerated/ignored without breaking the response (TC07).
Server Error Handling: Infrastructure failures and timeouts surface as 500/503/504 with error messages (TC08, TC11).
Performance/Resilience: Large datasets and concurrent requests are exercised (TC09, TC14).
Backward Compatibility: Older client access still returns 200 with expected body (TC13).
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios validating pagination behavior for large result sets (e.g., limit/offset/page) or verifying that pagination is not supported and how the API responds.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No tests for burst traffic leading to 429 or validation of Retry-After/RateLimit headers.
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control headers or conditional GET returning 304.
Authorization (403): No scenario where credentials are valid but insufficient (RBAC/tenant isolation), expecting 403.
Error Contract: Error responses are not validated against a standard schema (e.g., code, message, type) and content-type for errors.

recommendations: Add pagination tests: happy path with limit/offset, boundaries (0, max), invalid values (negative, non-numeric), and deterministic ordering if defined. If pagination is not supported, add a scenario proving pagination params are rejected (400) or ignored per spec.
Add rate limiting scenarios: generate bursts to exceed limits, assert 429 Too Many Requests and validate Retry-After/RateLimit headers.
Add caching scenarios: assert presence of ETag/Cache-Control on 200 responses; send If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to verify 304 Not Modified and correct cache directives.

Validate error response schema and headers consistently across 400/404/422/500/503/504: check application/json content-type, error code, message, and trace/correlation id if standard.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/tags - Retrieve payment tags

Empty Response: Invoice payment with no tags returns 200 and an empty array; not-found cases return 404.

Resiliency/Errors: 500 Internal Server Error and 503 dependency failure; transient failure with retry; regression test for includedDeleted behavior.

gaps: Authorization: No test for insufficient permissions/roles returning 403; only missing token (401) is covered.

recommendations: Add authorization tests for a valid token without required permissions returning 403, differentiating clearly from 401.
Add caching tests: assert ETag/Cache-Control headers on 200; perform conditional GET with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since and expect 304 when appropriate.
Introduce rate limiting tests: send rapid bursts to trigger 429 Too Many Requests and verify Retry-After/backoff behavior.

Incorporate JSON schema validation for Tag and for error responses (400/404/500/503) to ensure contract compliance.
Expand query param robustness: invalid boolean for includedDeleted -> 400; audit value case sensitivity; URL-encoded and special characters in pluginProperty.
Test pluginProperty over the documented maximum (N+1) to confirm proper error handling (e.g., 400) and define expected behavior for duplicates/order.
Add content negotiation tests: Accept: application/json succeeds; unsupported Accept returns 406; verify response Content-Type includes charset if required.
Clarify pagination support for this endpoint. If not supported, add a test asserting no pagination headers are present; if supported, add limit/offset and large-list navigation tests.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Add custom fields to invoice item

POST - Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON, missing body, invalid invoiceItemId format, and missing required header produce 400 (TC06–TC09).
POST - Non-Existing Resource: 404 for non-existent invoice item and empty DB states (TC05, TC22, TC23).
Authorization: Unauthenticated/invalid credentials yield 401/403 (TC12).
Duplicate Submission/Idempotency & Concurrency: Retry after transient failure avoids duplicates; concurrent requests handled with appropriate codes and correct final state (TC16, TC25).
Large Payloads: Max-allowed count scenario covered (TC14).
Validation Edge Cases: Field length boundaries, special characters, and injection attempts covered (TC19–TC21).
Server Error Handling: Service unavailable 503 covered (TC13).
Integration/Persistence: Created fields retrievable via GET (TC18).
Performance: Normal and degraded response-time checks (TC15, TC24).
gaps: Content negotiation and media type: No test for missing/incorrect Content-Type header leading to 415; response Content-Type application/json not asserted.
CustomField schema validation: No tests for missing required properties within each object (e.g., name/value), nulls, or wrong data types while body is well-formed JSON.
Large payloads beyond limits: No explicit test for above-maximum arrays or payload-size limits that should result in 413 (separate from “at max” case).
Server error 500: No scenario simulating internal errors (e.g., DB failure) returning 500 as per POST guidelines.

Ambiguous expectations: Several tests allow multiple outcomes (e.g., TC11 extra fields: 201 or 400; TC14: 201 or 413; TC17 duplicates unspecified), reducing verifiability against a single expected behavior.
Idempotency without transient failure: No explicit test sending the exact same payload twice under normal conditions to assert business rule (no duplicates, consistent status such as 200/201/409).
Header validations: No tests for length/charset/Unicode handling of X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment, or auditing effects if required.
recommendations: Add media-type tests: send valid JSON with Content-Type missing or text/plain and assert 415; assert response Content-Type is application/json on success and errors.

Split boundary tests: one for “at maximum” -> 201, another for “above maximum” -> 413; consider also testing large byte-size payloads (very long strings).
Add a 500 Internal Server Error scenario (e.g., simulated DB failure) to meet POST server-error handling guidelines.
Make outcomes deterministic: replace “201 or 400/413” with the single expected code per spec for TC11, TC14, TC17; document business rules for extra fields and duplicate field names.
Add an explicit idempotency test: submit the identical request twice (no network failure) and verify no duplicate records, with defined expected status (e.g., 201 then 200 or 409).
Optionally add rate-limiting (429) tests if the API enforces throttling; and audit/traceability checks to ensure X-Killbill-Reason/Comment are recorded where applicable.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to invoice item

covered_items: PUT - Valid Request: Multiple success paths verify 204 responses and database updates for required-only and optional headers, with and without prior custom fields (TC01–TC05, TC21, TC22).
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: 404 when invoice item does not exist, including empty DB state and mixed state (TC07, TC24, TC25).
Path Parameter Validation: Invalid UUID format yields 400 (TC06).
Request Body Validation: Malformed JSON 400 (TC08), empty body 400 (TC10), unsupported fields 400 (TC11), large payload boundary behavior 204/413 (TC12), max-size performance still 204 (TC21).
Headers Validation: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy present vs missing (204 vs 400) and optional Reason/Comment accepted (TC01–TC03, TC09, TC02).
Authorization: 401 for invalid/missing auth token (TC13).
Robustness/Error Handling: Simulated 500 (DB down), 503 (dependent service down), and 504 (timeout) covered (TC15, TC19, TC16).
Idempotency: Repeated identical PUTs remain consistent and return 204 (TC17).
Edge Conditions: No prior fields vs existing fields (TC04–TC05); minimum allowed values (TC22).
Security Input Hardening: SQL injection payloads rejected with proper error codes (TC14).
Nonfunctional/Performance: Parallel updates across many items and acceptable response times (TC20).
Query Strictness: Extra query parameter handling covered (TC23).
gaps: PUT Semantics (replace vs merge): No scenarios define whether PUT replaces the entire set of custom fields or merges; behavior when payload omits existing fields is untested.
Partial Update Rejection: No scenario verifying that partial updates are rejected unless explicitly allowed (per PUT guidelines).
Concurrency on Same Resource: No race-condition test where two clients update the same invoice item concurrently; no expected conflict/last-write-wins behavior defined (e.g., 409/412).
Content-Type Enforcement: No test that missing or incorrect Content-Type (e.g., text/plain) yields 415 Unsupported Media Type.
Accept/Response Headers: No checks that error responses are application/json and that 204 responses return no body (Content-Length: 0).
CustomField Schema Validation: Missing tests for required attributes, invalid data types, nulls, enum violations, and max-length constraints for fields.
Duplicate/Conflicting Fields: No scenario for duplicate CustomField entries for the same key/name and the deduplication or error policy.
Empty Array Semantics: No test for sending an empty array [] (clear all fields vs no-op) and the expected status/effect.
Header Value Constraints: No tests for empty/whitespace or overlong X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment values, or non-ASCII characters.
Authorization Depth: 403 Forbidden (authenticated but not authorized) is not covered.
Error Contract Consistency: No assertions on standardized error payload structure (code, message, details) across 4xx/5xx responses.
recommendations: Define and test PUT semantics: add scenarios for (a) subset of fields provided (expect replace vs merge) and (b) empty array [] to clear all fields or return 400, according to spec.
Add concurrency tests on the same invoice item: simulate two parallel conflicting PUTs; assert expected behavior (e.g., ETag/If-Match with 412, or 409 conflict, or deterministic last-write-wins).
Add Content-Type and Accept tests: wrong/missing Content-Type => 415; verify error responses have application/json; assert 204 has no response body.
Expand CustomField schema tests: missing required keys, invalid data types, null values, value length boundaries, enumerations; expect 400/422 as per contract.
Add duplicate field handling tests: same custom field name/key repeated; define and assert dedup or error policy.
Add header value validation: empty/whitespace, excessively long, and non-ASCII values for X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment; assert expected outcomes.
Include 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated users without permission to modify invoice items.
Standardize and assert error payload contract (fields like code/message) for 400/404/401/413/422/5xx to improve client reliability.
Optionally, verify audit behavior: CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are recorded and retrievable via audit endpoints if applicable.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from invoice item

covered_items: Valid Deletion: Multiple success paths (delete all, delete subset, duplicates, large list) verify 204 and that only intended custom fields are removed.
Non-Existent Resource: 404 for a valid-but-missing invoiceItemId is covered.
Path and query validation: invalid invoiceItemId (400), malformed customField values (400), mixed valid/invalid IDs (400), extra params tolerated, duplicates handled.
Headers: required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (400 when missing); optional X-Killbill-Reason/Comment accepted; long Comment and lenient header parsing covered.
Security/Resilience: Unauthorized token (401), injection attempt in query (400/422), dependency failure (503), and load/performance conditions are tested.
Idempotency baseline: Deleting when no custom fields remain returns 204 (graceful no-op).
gaps: Concurrency: No scenarios for simultaneous deletions or interleaving operations (e.g., two users deleting the same fields at once) to confirm race-free behavior.
Soft delete/audit behavior: Not validated whether removals are soft-deleted with audit entries or hard-deleted; no checks that Reason/Comment show up in audit logs.
Unknown-but-valid customField IDs: Missing case where provided UUIDs are valid but do not belong to the invoice item; expected result (ignore vs error) is not defined or tested.
Empty customField parameter: Behavior when customField is present but empty (e.g., customField=) is not exercised.
Idempotent repeat: No test that repeating the exact same DELETE after a 204 still returns 204 and makes no changes.
Response headers: The story states Produces application/json, but tests don’t assert response headers for 204/4xx (e.g., Content-Type on errors, Content-Length/absence of body on 204).
Authorization/permission granularity: 403 forbidden (authenticated but not authorized) is not covered, if applicable.
Whitespace/formatting in parameter values: Not tested for trimmed UUIDs or values with leading/trailing spaces, or case normalization for header values beyond basic parsing.
recommendations: Add a concurrency scenario: fire two DELETEs concurrently for the same invoice item and overlapping customField IDs; assert deterministic outcome (both 204 and state consistent, or well-defined 409/404 on one request).
Verify soft-delete/audit semantics: after a successful DELETE, fetch audit logs and assert X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are recorded; clarify whether deletions are soft vs hard.
Add test for valid-but-nonexistent customField IDs (belonging to another item or not present at all) to define whether the API ignores unknown IDs (204) or errors (400/404).
Add scenario where customField is present but empty (customField= or customField with no value); define and assert expected behavior.
Add explicit idempotency test: repeat the same DELETE and ensure it remains a no-op with 204.

Assert response headers: ensure errors return application/json with standard error schema; for 204 verify empty body and appropriate headers (e.g., no Content-Type or Content-Length: 0 as per service conventions).
Extend header validation: long/Unicode X-Killbill-CreatedBy and X-Killbill-Reason, blank/whitespace-only CreatedBy, and header injection attempts (CRLF) should be validated.
Add parameter formatting tests: UUIDs with uppercase letters, leading/trailing spaces, and confirm collectionFormat=multi is honored (vs comma-separated values rejected or handled explicitly).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from payment

covered_items: DELETE Method - Valid Deletion: Success paths covered for removing all custom fields (no query param) and removing specific fields via multi-valued customField parameter, returning 204 with empty body (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC06, TC07, TC10, TC15, TC19, TC20, TC21, TC23).

Invalid customField ID handling: 400 for malformed UUIDs and for mixed valid/invalid values (TC13, TC16).

gaps: DELETE Method - Concurrency: No scenarios for race conditions or idempotency under concurrent deletes (e.g., two clients deleting same fields simultaneously or rapid repeated DELETEs).
DELETE Method - Soft Deletes: No explicit validation of soft-delete behavior vs hard delete. If soft delete is expected, there is no check for a deleted flag or retrieval semantics post-delete.

Duplicate IDs in query: No test where the same customField UUID is repeated to ensure deduplication/consistent behavior.

Authorization 403: No scenario for authenticated user lacking permissions (forbidden) vs unauthenticated (401).
Unexpected request body: Request Body is N/A; no test sending a body to confirm it is rejected (e.g., 415/400) or ignored per API contract.

recommendations: Add concurrency/idempotency tests: fire two parallel DELETEs on the same payment custom fields; assert both return 204 and state ends consistent. Add a repeat-delete scenario to verify idempotency.

Clarify and test soft-delete vs hard-delete: if soft delete applies, verify deleted flag/audit visibility; if hard delete, assert subsequent GET of custom fields returns none with no residual markers.
Add a test with duplicate customField UUIDs in the query to validate deduplication/consistent results.
Add a mixed-validity existence test using well-formed UUIDs where some exist and some do not (define expected behavior: ignore unknowns and succeed vs fail with 400).
Add validation for empty/blank customField values (customField= and whitespace) to ensure proper 400 responses.
Verify response headers on 204: assert no body and Content-Type behavior is correct per API (often absent for 204), or align with Produces contract.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for an authenticated but unauthorized principal to distinguish from 401.
Add a test that includes an unintended request body to ensure the API rejects (415/400) or ignores it, matching documentation.
Include a negative path simulating backend failure to confirm 500 error handling and stable contract.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to account

covered_items: PUT: Valid Request — Multiple success paths verify 204 and persistence of updates (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC15, TC16, TC17, TC24, TC26 within limits).
PUT: Non-Existing/Invalid Resource — Invalid UUID format (TC06) and non-existent account handling present (TC07), covering the story’s 400 error expectation.

Headers — Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (TC08); optional Reason/Comment accepted (TC02); extra headers ignored (TC05).
Authorization and robustness — 401 for missing/invalid auth (TC12); resilience scenarios include 502/503/504 and retry logic (TC13, TC14, TC19, TC22).
Boundaries — Empty array semantics (TC15), large arrays (TC04), payload near limit and 413 on overflow (TC26), duplicate field names rejected (TC23).

gaps: PUT: Partial update semantics — No test clarifies whether sending a subset of custom fields merges or replaces the full set; guideline expects explicit handling (reject unless allowed).
PUT: Concurrency on the same resource — No scenario where two clients update the same account concurrently; no conflict detection (409/412) or last-write-wins behavior verified.
PUT: Idempotency — No test that repeating the exact same PUT yields 204 with no additional changes and identical final state.

Non-existing resource status — TC07 expects 400; if the contract intends 404 for missing accounts, coverage mismatches the guideline; needs clarification and a dedicated 404 case if applicable.

recommendations: Add explicit partial-update tests: send a subset of fields and verify whether the server replaces the full set or rejects partial updates; document expected behavior.
Add concurrency tests on the same account: two simultaneous PUTs with different payloads; assert conflict handling (409/412 via ETag/If-Match) or clearly document and verify last-write-wins.

Strengthen atomicity: extend TC18 to assert that no valid objects are applied when any object is invalid; verify pre/post state consistency.

Verify response headers and bodies: assert no response body for 204; assert Content-Type application/json and structured error body for 4xx/5xx; optionally test Accept header behavior.
Add header value validation: empty/whitespace and overly long X-Killbill-CreatedBy should be rejected; confirm CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are captured in audit logs (extend TC27).

Expand schema validation: add tests for invalid data types, out-of-range/length violations (just-over limits), and enforce or reject additional properties per the CustomField schema (update TC17 based on schema).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/payments - Trigger a payment (authorization, purchase or credit)
