Determinism: Some scenarios specify “201 or 400 depending on system limits”; acceptance tests should have deterministic outcomes.
recommendations: Add idempotency tests: submit the same PaymentTransaction (same transactionExternalKey or X-Killbill-Idempotency-Key) twice; expect first 201, subsequent idempotent response without new charge (e.g., 200/201 with same resource) or a clear conflict code.
Introduce a 500 Internal Server Error scenario (e.g., simulated DB outage) to verify proper error mapping, no partial writes, and observability in error responses.
Create explicit missing-field tests: omit amount, currency, or transactionType individually; expect 400 with field-level validation messages.
Add transactionType-specific scenarios: authorization, purchase, and credit paths with assertions on resulting transaction state and semantics.
Expand paymentMethodId validation: invalid UUID -> 400; non-existent -> 404 or 400; payment method not linked to the account -> 400/403 as applicable.
Add control plugin negative tests: unknown controlPluginName -> 400; invalid pluginProperty shape/type -> 400.
Incorporate JSON Schema validation against #/definitions/Payment and PaymentTransaction for both request and response.
Verify Location header: perform a GET on the Location URL and assert the resource exists and matches the created payment details.
Add content negotiation tests: set Accept: application/json (success) and an unsupported Accept to confirm proper error (e.g., 406).
Split non-deterministic cases (e.g., large payload, extra parameters) into separate, deterministic scenarios; use appropriate HTTP codes (e.g., 413 Payload Too Large) where relevant.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/block - Block a bundle

covered_items: POST Valid Payload: Success with required and with all optional headers/query params returning 201 and a JSON array of BlockingState objects (TC01–TC04).
Input Validation: UUID format 400 (TC06), non-existent bundle 404 (TC05, TC07), malformed/missing body 400 (TC08, TC10), invalid requestedDate 400 (TC11), missing required header handled (TC09).
Optional Fields: Reason/Comment headers and pluginProperty multi-value parsing verified (TC02, TC03, TC04).
Boundary/Limits: Min/max fields, large payload stress (TC13–TC16).
Security Hardening: Injection and XSS sanitized/rejected; special characters/encoding regression covered (TC19–TC20, TC23).
AuthN: Invalid token returns 401 (TC18).
Server/Infra Resilience: Service unavailable 503, dependency error 502/503, transient network retry (TC17, TC28, TC21).
Performance/Scale: Response time under normal/peak and resource utilization under bulk (TC25–TC27).
Concurrency: Multiple concurrent POSTs reflected correctly (TC22).
Integration Consistency: Created state reflected across systems (TC29).
gaps: Duplicate submission/idempotency not tested (same request retried causing duplicates vs safe dedupe; Idempotency-Key handling if supported).
500 Internal Server Error not simulated (e.g., DB write failure) with expected error contract.
Content negotiation/headers not verified: missing or wrong Content-Type => 415; unsupported Accept => 406; assert Content-Type application/json on 201 and errors.
Request body schema strictness not covered: unknown/extra fields in BlockingState (reject vs ignore). TC12 only covers extra query/header params.
requestedDate semantics untested: timezone handling, past/future scheduling rules, and default effective date when omitted.
pluginProperty validation gaps: empty value, non-string types, excessively long values, duplicate keys, and comma-separated vs repeated query param behavior.
Error response schema not asserted (structure/code/message consistency, no PII leakage).
Ambiguous expectations in TC09/TC12/TC16/TC19/TC20 (e.g., "201 or 400", "sanitizes or rejects") reduce determinism and traceability.
Rate limiting/throttling behavior (429) under sustained bursts not covered.
Persistence/audit: No follow-up GET to confirm state persisted; no verification that CreatedBy/Reason/Comment appear in audit/history.
Response headers not asserted (e.g., Content-Type, optional Location if applicable).
recommendations: Add idempotency tests: send identical POST twice (with and without Idempotency-Key if supported) and define expected outcome (201 once + 200/409/duplicate ignore).
Simulate 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., DB failure) and assert status code and error schema.
Add content negotiation tests: wrong/missing Content-Type -> 415; unsupported Accept -> 406; assert Content-Type application/json on success/errors.
Test schema strictness: include unknown fields in BlockingState and assert reject vs ignore per spec; add negative type checks for each field.
Extend requestedDate tests: past date, future date scheduling, timezone (UTC vs local), and default effectiveDate when omitted (close to server time).
Broaden pluginProperty coverage: empty values, non-string types, extremely long values, duplicate keys, and comma-separated vs repeated param parsing.
Define and verify a consistent error contract (fields like code, message, type) across 400/404/5xx responses.
Resolve ambiguous scenarios by splitting into explicit expected outcomes (e.g., sanitize-and-201 vs reject-with-400) and aligning with API spec.
Add rate limiting/throttling test to verify 429 or documented behavior under bursts.
Add persistence verification: after 201, GET the bundle’s blocking states to confirm data persisted and matches request (including effectiveDate).
Validate audit trail: confirm CreatedBy/Reason/Comment stored in history/audit endpoints.
Assert response headers on 201 (Content-Type and any Location/links if applicable).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/admin/cache/accounts/{accountId} - Invalidates Caches per account level

covered_items: DELETE Method - Valid Deletion: 204 with empty body and cache invalidation verified (TC01, TC09, TC17, TC19).
DELETE Method - Non-Existent Resource: 404 when account is missing or DB empty (TC02, TC16, TC18).
Input Validation of Path Parameter: 400 on malformed UUID/invalid patterns and attack payloads (TC03, TC10, TC12, TC14, TC15).
Authentication: 401 for missing or expired/invalid credentials (TC05, TC06).
Resilience/Dependency Failures: 503 when cache service is unavailable or system is degraded, plus successful retry after transient network failure (TC07, TC08, TC17).
Unsupported Method Handling: 405 for a non-DELETE method (GET) (TC11).
Query Parameters: Extra parameters are tolerated/ignored without breaking the operation (TC09).
Performance/Concurrency Under Load: Concurrent DELETEs across accounts succeed and meet latency expectations (TC13).
gaps: DELETE Concurrency/Idempotency on the same account not covered: no scenarios for simultaneous or repeated DELETEs on the same account to prove idempotency and absence of race conditions.
Headers/content negotiation not validated: no checks for Content-Type on error responses or Accept handling; story notes "Produces: application/json". No check for Retry-After on 503.
Authorization/roles: no scenario for an authenticated non-admin user (403 Forbidden).
Server error handling: no simulation of internal failures (e.g., DB/cache provider exception) to validate 500 responses.
Unsupported methods coverage incomplete: only GET tested; POST/PUT/PATCH/HEAD/OPTIONS not verified to return 405.
DELETE with unexpected request body not tested (should be ignored or rejected per API policy).
Ambiguous expectation in TC07 ("204 or 503") makes the test non-deterministic under the given preconditions.
Error response schema not validated (e.g., standard fields like code/message to ensure consistent API errors).
recommendations: Add idempotency and race-condition tests on the same account: run DELETE twice sequentially and concurrently for the same account; both should return 204 and leave caches in a consistent state.
Add a role-based access test: authenticated but non-admin requester should receive 403 Forbidden.
Add a server-failure scenario to assert 500 Internal Server Error and validate standardized error payload.
Validate headers: ensure 204 responses have an empty body; ensure 4xx/5xx responses include Content-Type: application/json; verify Retry-After header on 503 if emitted.
Extend unsupported-method tests to POST, PUT, PATCH, HEAD, and OPTIONS returning 405.
Add a scenario sending a DELETE with a request body to confirm it is ignored or rejected (400/415) per API policy.
Split TC07 into two separate, deterministic scenarios: one for high-load yet successful 204, another for service-unavailable 503.
Validate error response schema across 400/401/404/405/503 (e.g., fields "error", "message", "code").
Optional: if applicable to admin endpoints, add a rate-limiting/429 scenario for bursts of DELETEs.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Retrieve account tags

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy path retrieval returns 200 with a JSON array of Tag objects; Content-Type application/json verified.
Defaults: Without query params, only active tags are returned and audit info is absent (audit defaults to NONE).

Query Parameters: includedDeleted=true returns deleted tags; audit=FULL and audit=MINIMAL return appropriate audit details; combined parameters covered; unsupported audit value returns 400; unknown query params are ignored with 200.
Empty Response: Account with no tags returns 200 and an empty JSON array.
Error Handling: 400 for invalid accountId formats (partial, empty, whitespace, injection) and 404 for non-existent account.
Security/Validation: SQL injection and XSS attempts in inputs are rejected with 400.
Authorization: Missing/invalid auth tokens yield 401.
Operational Robustness: API down (503) and downstream failure (502) scenarios covered.
Non-functional: Large dataset performance, concurrency, regression, backward compatibility, and cross-system data consistency scenarios included.
gaps: Pagination: No tests verifying pagination behavior or confirming absence of pagination for large datasets.
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control headers, or conditional GET (304).
Rate Limiting: No scenarios for exceeding limits (e.g., 429 with Retry-After).
Authorization Depth: No 403 Forbidden case (valid token lacking permission/tenant access).
Explicit parameter defaults: No explicit test for audit=NONE or includedDeleted=false to confirm behavior matches defaults.
Parameter validation breadth: No test for non-boolean includedDeleted (e.g., includedDeleted=abc) resulting in 400.
Response Schema: Tag object and error payload schema are not validated against the API spec (fields, types, required properties).
Content negotiation: No Accept header tests (e.g., Accept: text/html -> 406 or fallback).
Ordering: No assertion about deterministic ordering or documentation that order is unspecified.
recommendations: Add pagination tests or, if not supported, add an explicit scenario asserting no pagination headers/links and that all tags are returned for large datasets.
Add caching scenarios: verify ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control on 200; send If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since and expect 304 when appropriate.
Introduce rate-limiting tests that burst requests to provoke 429 and verify Retry-After handling.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario where the caller lacks permission or cross-tenant access to the account.
Add explicit defaults tests: audit=NONE and includedDeleted=false should behave identically to no query params.
Validate parameter typing: includedDeleted with non-boolean values (e.g., abc, 1) should return 400 with a clear error.
Incorporate JSON schema validation for Tag arrays and standardized error bodies to ensure contract fidelity.
Test content negotiation with various Accept headers, ensuring proper 406 or consistent JSON responses.
Clarify and test ordering: either verify a defined sort order or assert that order is not guaranteed and tests should not depend on it.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/overdue - Retrieve overdue state for account

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful retrieval returns 200 with application/json and an OverdueState payload validated against the schema (TC01).
Empty Response: Handled via an account with no overdue state (200, appropriate representation) and non-existent account/database-empty cases returning 404 (TC02, TC03, TC13).
Path Parameter Validation and Security: Malformed/missing UUID, pattern mismatch, leading/trailing spaces, injection, and XSS attempts all yield 400 (TC04–TC06, TC10–TC11, TC16).
Authorization: Missing or invalid token correctly results in 401 (TC07–TC08).
Server/Dependency Errors: Internal server error and dependency timeouts/unavailability handled (500, 503/504) (TC09, TC17).
Query Parameters: Unknown/extra query parameter is safely ignored without altering successful behavior (TC12).
Schema and Backward Compatibility: OverdueState schema validation and response structure stability are asserted (TC01–TC02, TC12, TC20).
Performance and Resilience: Response time under normal load, concurrent requests, large payload handling, and retry after transient network failure are exercised (TC14–TC15, TC18–TC19).
gaps: Rate Limiting: No scenarios validate throttling behavior (429 Too Many Requests) or Retry-After headers.
Caching Behavior: No tests for ETag/If-None-Match, Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since, Cache-Control headers, or 304 Not Modified.
Error Response Consistency: No assertions that 4xx/5xx responses are JSON with a consistent error schema and Content-Type.
Authorization Granularity: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated-but-unauthorized users/tenants (if applicable).
Content Negotiation: No tests for Accept header variations (e.g., 406 Not Acceptable for non-JSON requests), if enforced.
recommendations: Add rate limiting tests that generate burst traffic to trigger 429, assert presence and correctness of Retry-After, and verify graceful degradation.
Add caching tests: verify ETag/Cache-Control on 200 responses; perform conditional GETs with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to assert 304 behavior and cache invalidation on change.
Validate error response schema and headers: ensure 400/404/5xx return application/json with consistent fields (e.g., code, message, requestId) and correct Content-Type/charset.
If RBAC/tenant enforcement exists, add a 403 Forbidden scenario to distinguish from 401 and confirm correct authorization semantics.
Add Accept header tests: Accept: application/json should succeed; unsupported media types should return 406 (or the documented behavior).
Clarify query-parameter contract: keep TC12 if extra params are meant to be ignored; if they should be rejected, add a negative test expecting 400 with a clear error message.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts - Retrieve an account by external key

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful retrieval by externalKey with default behavior and with optional parameters (accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA, audit FULL and MINIMAL) is verified, including Content-Type application/json.
Empty Response: Nonexistent externalKey and empty database both return 404 as expected.

Query Parameters: Extensive coverage of valid and invalid inputs, including malformed externalKey, invalid booleans, invalid audit value, boundary lengths (255/256), special characters, SQLi/XSS attempts, and ignoring unknown parameters.
Authorization: 401 behaviors for missing and invalid tokens are covered.
Resilience: Upstream and infrastructure error handling covered with 502 (bad gateway), 503 (service unavailable), and 504 (timeout).
Performance: Response-time targets validated under normal and concurrent load.
Backward compatibility and regression: Legacy client and previously problematic keys are validated.
Field-level semantics: Verifies that balance/CBA and audit fields are included or excluded according to query parameters.
gaps: Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control headers, or conditional GET with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since leading to 304.
Rate Limiting: No scenarios to validate 429 Too Many Requests or presence of rate limit headers under burst traffic.
Authorization depth: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated users lacking required permissions or roles.
Audit parameter completeness: No explicit test for audit=NONE equivalence to default and no case-sensitivity checks for the enum.
Boolean parameter robustness: No tests for explicit false values or alternative boolean encodings such as TRUE/FALSE or 0/1.
Schema contract: No full validation of the Account object against the published schema for required fields and data types.
Internationalization: No scenarios using Unicode or non-ASCII externalKey values to validate encoding and lookup.
Content negotiation: No tests for Accept headers and 406 Not Acceptable or charset handling.
Duplicate query parameters: No defined behavior when the same parameter appears multiple times in the query string.
Method semantics: No negative test ensuring unsupported methods on this path return 405 Method Not Allowed.
recommendations: Add caching tests: verify ETag and Cache-Control on 200 responses and perform conditional GETs to assert 304 Not Modified; ensure validators change when the account changes.
Introduce rate limiting scenarios to elicit 429 and validate Retry-After and X-RateLimit headers; also verify compliant behavior under limits.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario using a valid token without sufficient permissions.
Cover audit=NONE explicitly and verify case rules for the audit enum per spec.
Add tests with explicit accountWithBalance=false and accountWithBalanceAndCBA=false and alternate boolean encodings (TRUE/FALSE, 0/1).
Validate the Account response against the official schema (required fields, types, formats) rather than only presence or absence of balance/CBA/audit fields.
Include Unicode externalKey cases to confirm correct URL encoding/decoding and retrieval.
Test content negotiation with various Accept headers: application/json returns 200, unsupported types return 406; verify charset in Content-Type as applicable.
Define and test behavior for repeated query parameters to confirm precedence or rejection.
Add a negative test for unsupported HTTP methods on this endpoint returning 405 Method Not Allowed.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts - Create account

covered_items: POST - Valid Payload: Multiple success paths with required-only and all optional fields/headers, asserting 201, JSON Account response, and Location header (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC16).
POST - Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON, empty body, and missing required fields return 400 with error details (TC05, TC06, TC12).
Header requirements/validation: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy covered for both presence and type errors; optional headers exercised (TC02, TC04, TC08).
Large Payloads: Boundary test with maximum field sizes succeeds (TC11).
Authorization negative path: Unauthorized access returns 401 (TC09).
Server dependency/timeouts: Database outage and network timeout handled with 503 and 504 (TC10, TC14).
Location semantics/integration: Location header is used to GET the resource; retrieval matches created Account (TC20).
Robustness to extras: Extra JSON fields and unexpected headers don’t break creation (TC07, TC17).
Performance/concurrency: Concurrent POSTs complete within thresholds (TC18).
Security signal: Injection/XSS attempt considered and expected to be rejected or sanitized (TC15).
gaps: Duplicate Submission: TC13 is non-deterministic (201 or 409) and conflicts with Background (no conflicting accounts). Need deterministic policy tests: create once, then submit same payload again; or pre-seed duplicates; assert 201 vs 409 as per spec.

Field-level validation depth: No explicit tests for Account schema rules (e.g., invalid email format, phone number, currency/timezone/country codes, external key uniqueness/length, numeric ranges, string length/min/max).
Server Error Handling (500): No scenario for unexpected server exception returning 500 with proper error body and headers; also no transaction rollback verification.
Media types/content negotiation: Missing tests for request Content-Type enforcement (415 for non-JSON), response Content-Type = application/json, and 406 when Accept is unacceptable.
Rate limiting/throttling: No coverage for 429 Too Many Requests when exceeding POST rate limits; TC18 checks performance but not throttling behavior.
Optional header validation: No negative tests for X-Killbill-Reason/Comment (invalid types, excessive length, non-UTF8/control characters) or persistence/audit expectations.

Response schema completeness: No assertions that server-populated fields (e.g., accountId, externalKey echo, createdDate, defaults) are present and valid; no check that Location ID matches id in response body.
Security hardening specificity: TC15 has ambiguous outcome; no explicit assertions that malicious input is safely stored/escaped and never reflected/executed; no header injection tests.
Produces requirement: While JSON body is asserted, the response header for Content-Type: application/json is not verified.
Idempotency/retry behavior: No scenario covering safe client retries (e.g., network failure after create) to avoid duplicate accounts; no Idempotency-Key behavior if supported.
recommendations: Make duplicate handling deterministic: split into two scenarios with clear preconditions—(a) duplicate rejected with 409 and error schema; (b) duplicate accepted semantics if allowed—and ensure Background/seeding supports the test.

Add a field-level validation matrix: invalid email, invalid phone format, out-of-range numbers, unsupported currency/timezone/country codes, externalKey length/charset, overlong strings; assert 400 with field-specific error details.
Add server error simulation yielding 500 Internal Server Error and verify JSON error envelope, correlation ID if applicable, and that no partial resource is created.
Add media type tests: POST with Content-Type text/plain -> 415; POST with Accept text/plain -> 406; always assert response Content-Type is application/json on success and errors.
Add throttling tests: burst requests beyond configured limit should return 429 with Retry-After; verify compliant behavior resumes after backoff.
Extend optional header tests: invalid types and maximum lengths for X-Killbill-Reason/Comment; include Unicode and control-character handling; verify audit persistence if part of requirements.

Assert response schema completeness: verify presence/format of accountId, createdDate/defaults; confirm Location path contains the same id as response body; verify absolute/relative URL format as per API contract.

Harden security tests: assert stored/returned fields are sanitized/escaped and not executed; include attempts with JSON-breaking characters and header injection; ensure no reflection in error responses.
Verify Produces contract explicitly by checking response headers for Content-Type: application/json on 201 and 4xx/5xx.

Add idempotent retry behavior test (if supported): simulate client retry after network timeout; with Idempotency-Key (or equivalent), expect single resource creation; without it, define expected behavior.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId} - Retrieve a bundle by id

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful 200 responses with application/json for a valid UUID; verifies default audit=NONE and explicit audit=FULL/MINIMAL/NONE.
Query Parameters: Covers valid values, omission (default), invalid value (400), and unknown parameter (ignored with 200).
Path Parameter Validation & Security: Malformed UUID returns 400; XSS/injection in bundleId rejected with 400 and not executed.
Not Found/Empty Data: 404 for non-existent bundle and when DB is empty.
Authorization: 401 for missing and invalid tokens.
Resiliency: 503 service unavailable; transient 500 with client retry succeeding; network timeout behavior captured.
Non-functional: Large bundle performance threshold and concurrent GETs returning correct, consistent data.
Content Negotiation (basic): Content-Type application/json asserted for success responses.
Backward compatibility: Scenario to ensure structure compatibility when audit omitted.
Pagination: Not applicable to a single-resource GET.
gaps: Schema Validation: Tests assert a “valid Bundle object” but do not validate against #/definitions/Bundle (required fields/types, id match).
Error Response Schema: No consistent validation of error body structure (e.g., code, message, type) or Content-Type for error responses.
Authorization - 403: No scenario for authenticated user lacking permissions/tenant access returning 403 (if applicable).
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control headers or conditional GET (If-None-Match -> 304).
Rate Limiting: No scenarios for throttling/429 Too Many Requests and Retry-After header.
Accept Header Handling: No tests for Accept negotiation (e.g., unsupported Accept -> 406 or documented fallback).
Audit Param Edge Cases: No tests for case-insensitivity (full vs FULL), surrounding whitespace, or duplicate audit params (precedence).
TC16 Quality: The “uppercase” UUID example contains only digits and doesn’t actually vary case; does not verify case-insensitivity for hex letters.
recommendations: Add JSON Schema validation for the Bundle response against #/definitions/Bundle, including required fields and id equality to the path parameter.
Validate error responses use a consistent schema and Content-Type (application/json), asserting fields like status, code, message.
Add a 403 Forbidden test for a valid token without required scope/tenant (if the API enforces RBAC/multi-tenancy).
Add caching scenarios: verify ETag/Cache-Control presence; perform conditional GET with If-None-Match to assert 304 Not Modified.
Introduce rate limiting tests: burst requests leading to 429 Too Many Requests and verify Retry-After.
Add Accept header tests: Accept: application/json returns 200 JSON; unsupported Accept (e.g., application/xml) yields 406 or the documented behavior.
Extend audit parameter tests: case-insensitive values, trimming whitespace, and handling duplicates (first/last-wins or 400 if ambiguous).
Fix TC16 to truly test case-insensitivity by using a UUID with hex letters (e.g., abcdefab-1234-5678-9abc-def012345678) and issuing the request with uppercase letters in the path.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/emails - Retrieve an account emails

covered_items: Valid Request: 200 response with application/json and a JSON array of AccountEmail objects for an existing account (TC01).
Empty Response: 200 with an empty JSON array when the account has no emails (TC02) and when a valid-format but non-existent accountId is used (TC04).
Input validation and security hardening: 400 on invalid UUID format and rejection of SQLi/XSS inputs without leaking details (TC03, TC10, TC11).
Authorization: Unauthenticated/unauthorized requests yield 401/403 (TC05).
Query Parameters: Unknown/extra query parameter is handled without breaking the response (TC07).
Resilience and performance: 503 service unavailability covered; large dataset and concurrency/performance scenarios present (TC06, TC08, TC13).
Produces header: application/json verified via Content-Type check (TC01).
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios validating pagination behavior for large datasets or explicitly asserting that pagination is not supported.
Rate Limiting: No tests verifying throttling behavior (e.g., HTTP 429) or presence of rate-limit headers under burst traffic.
Caching Behavior: No validation of ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control, or conditional GET resulting in 304.
Schema fidelity: Response is not validated against the authoritative AccountEmail schema (required fields, data types, formats, additionalProperties).
Error contract: Tests do not consistently assert a standard machine-readable error schema across 400/401/403/503.
Ambiguity for non-existent accounts: TC04 assumes 200 with empty array, but the story does not define whether 404 should be returned—needs clarification.
Query parameter semantics: The spec lists no query params; TC07 assumes unknown params are ignored. Desired behavior (ignore vs 400) should be clarified and enforced.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: If supported, cover limit/offset (or equivalent), defaults, boundaries, and navigation/Link headers; if not supported, add a scenario explicitly asserting no pagination and full result delivery.
Add rate limiting tests: Generate bursts to verify 429 behavior and validate X-Rate-Limit/Retry-After headers (or explicitly assert absence if not implemented).
Add caching tests: Capture ETag/Last-Modified and perform conditional GETs (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) to expect 304; verify appropriate Cache-Control directives.
Add strict schema validation: Validate each AccountEmail object against the OpenAPI/JSON Schema (required fields, types, email format, boolean flags, and no unexpected fields).
Standardize error response checks: Assert a consistent error JSON structure (e.g., code, message, type, requestId) and absence of stack traces for 400/401/403/503.
Clarify expected behavior for non-existent accountId (200 empty vs 404) and update TC04 accordingly.
Clarify handling of unknown query parameters and update/extend TC07 to assert the agreed behavior (ignore with 200 or reject with 400).
Optionally, add content negotiation tests using Accept headers to verify 406 Not Acceptable or defaulting to application/json as per Produces.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/customFields/pagination - List custom fields

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple success scenarios verify 200 responses and JSON arrays of CustomField objects, including default parameters and combinations (offset, limit, audit).
Empty Response: Scenario covers no data case returning 200 with an empty array.
Pagination: Extensive tests for offset/limit, start index correctness, partial parameters, large datasets, and regression/concurrency checks for correct slicing.
Query Parameters: Broad coverage of valid and invalid values (negative/zero limits, invalid audit, unsupported params ignored, extreme int64 values) and injection resilience.
Authorization: Missing/invalid token returns 401.
Fault tolerance: Service unavailability (503) and timeout (503/504) scenarios included.
Schema compliance: Scenarios validate objects follow the documented CustomField schema.
gaps: Rate Limiting: No scenarios validating throttling behavior (e.g., 429 Too Many Requests) or Retry-After headers.

Authorization (Forbidden): No 403 scenario for authenticated users lacking permissions/tenant access.

Invalid data types/formatting: No tests for non-integer offset/limit (strings, floats), empty/whitespace values, or audit enum case sensitivity.
Pagination boundaries: Offset beyond total count and last-page remainder behavior not explicitly validated.
Ordering determinism: No assertion of stable sort order across pages to prevent gaps/duplicates during pagination.

recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests to trigger/verify 429 and Retry-After under burst traffic; also confirm normal behavior under quota.
Add caching tests: assert ETag/Cache-Control/Last-Modified; perform conditional GETs expecting 304 when unchanged.
Add a 403 test: valid token but insufficient privileges/tenant access should return 403.
Assert response headers: Content-Type application/json (and charset); optionally verify Accept negotiation.
Add invalid type/format tests for offset/limit (strings, floats, empty/whitespace) and audit enum case sensitivity.
Add pagination boundary tests: offset beyond total returns empty array; last page returns remainder; offset == total returns empty.
Assert deterministic ordering across pages (e.g., by id/createdDate) and verify no overlaps or gaps when iterating pages.
Test behavior with duplicate query parameters and define expected precedence or 400 error.
Tighten TC16 by aligning expectations with documented parameter limits instead of allowing “200 or 400 depending on constraints.”

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/auditLogsWithHistory - Retrieve invoice item audit logs with history by id

covered_items: Valid Request: 200 OK with JSON array of AuditLog objects; required fields are validated for a valid invoice item ID.

Error Scenario (404): Non-existent invoice item ID returns 404 with an explanatory message.

Resilience/Performance/Security: Database unavailability (503), large histories/performance under load, injection (SQLi) and XSS negatives, regression checks, backward compatibility, and concurrency behavior are covered.
gaps: Rate Limiting: No scenarios validating throttling behavior (e.g., 429 Too Many Requests and Retry-After or X-RateLimit headers) under burst traffic.
